menu.menu: Creates a new project.
Opens an AHK file for editing.
Opens an explorer window to the folder where the current Project is stored.
Closes the current Project. This will also close the parent project if you are currently in a Segment.
Closes all of the open projects

Saves all unsaved files (All Projects and Segments are saved as well as backups of previous versions which can be accessed by using the Edit/Restore feature or by navigating to the directory where the Project is stored and then into the Backup directory)
Save the project As a new project. This will leave the old project in tact so you need to delete the old one
Compiles all of the Segments of a Project and saves it to a file.
Compiles the current project and places the exe file in the project directory. If the file upx.exe is in the AHK Studio directory it will also compress it.
Gives you an edit control to add whatever you want to be pre-populated when you create a new Project
Creates another Scintilla edit window
Removes a Scintilla window
Creates a new Segment for the current Project (adds an include)
Rename the current Segment
Removes a segment (include) from the project.
Executes the current Project
When you run a script using AHK Studio it keeps track of the processes. This will allow you to kill those running processes. (Will cause orphan icons in the System Tray)

Brings up a version tracking window that allows you to create a changelog that will be automatically uploaded with your script to an FTP server of your choice (FTP server setup can be done in Options/Settings). This screen also has a checkbox for compiling your script and uploading the compiled EXE as well.
Saves all of the Segments (if you have any) into one script and places it into your clipboard so you can paste it on whatever forum, file, or website you like.
Creates a text file in the AHK Studio\Notes directory and adds it to your Project Explorer. You can use this file to keep track of ideas.
Works pretty much the same as Full Backup but removes all previous Full Backups
Re-Indexes your lib files in the off chance the Functions/Classes stop coming up
Refreshes the current Project if you change or remove an #Include in the text rather than doing it in Studios menus.
Re-Indexes all of your Projects and fixes errors in the Project Explorer
Careful! This will remove the entire directory where your project is saved!
When you have your Project working properly you can do a Full Backup and it will get rid of all of the backup files that you have made since the last Full Backup.
Opens a gui that shows the scripts you have closed.
Sets AHK Studio as the default editor. Requires the script to be ran as administrator.
Exits the program. This saves all of your edited files and saves the old version to %A_ScriptDir%\Backup.
Compiles the AHK Studio script so that you can have it in your Taskbar
Downloads the source code for Studio if you have compiled it
Similar to Publish but this will also get the lib functions that you do not make an #Include call to
Will dynamically run the current segment
This will trigger all of your files to save the current state
Reverts to a previous point in the document history
Same as Ctrl+Y
Cuts the currently selected text to the clipboard.
Copies the currently selected text to the clipboard.
Pastes the contents of your clipboard into the current Segment or Project at the caret position.
Use this to create, save, export, and import Themes. ![Theme.PNG](http://www.maestrith.com/files/AHKStudio/Theme.PNG)
Creates a duplicate of the line that your caret is in, or if you have text selected it will duplicate that.
When you have selected text with squares around the duplicates, this will select the next duplicate
Brings up an InputBox to enter a phrase to replace all selected text.
Shows a dialog to add replacement text to. Eg. (g,Gui) would replace lower case g with Gui if you type (" ",",",or "(") after it.
Adds a new segment to your project using the selected text.
Adds or removes ; at the beginning of a line.
This option is mainly used for those who decide to turn off Auto Fix Indentation. It indents your code by Blocks (code between { and })
Allows you to edit the Syntax, Colored Text, and Auto Menus without having to worry about an update changing things
Gives you the ability to change the default Project folder when creating new Projects
Brings up a dialog containing all of the backup files of the current Segment. You can browse through the list of backed up Segments and then you can restore them to a previous state.
Keeps track of the indenting of your script
Folds the current line
Folds all available folds
Folds all text that can be folded
Folds only the lines that are in the current fold level
Allows you to choose what fold level to fold. Each indentation is a fold level
Unfolds all folded lines
Unfolds all of the folded lines in the current level
Unfolds the lines from the entered level
Searches through all of the Segments under the current Project for specified text and displays the results. Select the result you wish to jump to and press enter.
Searches for a search string and allows you to replace it with another string
Jumps to the next selected text.
Jumps to the previous selected text.
Displays a dropdown list of all of the text in that document
Wherever your cursor it within a word you can jump to the Class associated with that text
Wherever your cursor it within a word you can jump to the First Available Text associated with that text
Wherever your cursor it within a word you can jump to the Function associated with that text
Wherever your cursor it within a word you can jump to the Include associated with that text
Wherever your cursor it within a word you can jump to the Label associated with that text
Wherever your cursor it within a word you can jump to the Method associated with that text
Opens a dialog to ask what line you would like to go to
Opens the Omni-Search window with ^
Sets focus to the Quick Find edit control. This searches through the current segment using normal or Regex search.
Makes the search Case Sensitive
Clears custom search areas created by "Set Selection"
Uses the Greed option in regex
Quick Find: Toggles Multi-Line
Makes the search a regex search
Creates a search selection based on what you have selected
This will bring up a list of all of your Classes and Functions and insert a call to it in your code
Opens up the Omni-Search window with #
Opens up the Omni-Search window with {
Opens up the Omni-Search window with (
Opens up the Omni-Search window with &
Opens Omni-Search with <
Opens up the Omni-Search window with @
Opens up the Omni-Search window with [
Opens up the Omni-Search window with nothing entered
Opens the Omni-Search window with .
Opens up the Omni-Search window with : entered
Opens the Omni-Search window with %
Pastes the current project to p.ahkscript.org
Pastes your clipboard to p.ahkscript.org
This will download plugins
Will reload Studio
Refreshes your plugins in the AHK Studio\Plugins directory
Debugs your current script using the debugging engine.
Debugging: After you Debug the current script you use this to run the code
Debugging:
Does the Step Into function for debugging
Does the Step Out function for debugging
Does the Step Over function for debugging
Debugging: Stops the debugger
Executes whatever selected text that is in the current Segment.
If you create a comment block with usable code and then Run Comment Block it will run what is inside that comment block
Executes the current Project using the Ansii binaries
Executes the current Project using the U32 binaries
Executes the current Project using the U64 binaries
Add a bookmark
Delete a bookmark
This edits the custom bookmark
Jumps to the next bookmark
Jumps to the previous bookmark
Opens a dialog so you can manage your bookmarks
A small Scintilla window that allows you to test some code
Allows you to add your own personal variables to the program so when you type it will bring them up along with the standard commands.
A place to store code snippets [Video Here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=URk_C9fE-Ok&list=UUK-F1YEzAYtczSuMxwPaRtw)
Allows you to edit the max_depth and max_children settings for debugging
Re-organize the menus, change hotkeys, and quick access to the options
Dialog for adding your own FTP servers so that you can upload your code using File/Upload
Opens a dialog to manage the toolbars
Opens a dialog to upload your script to Github
Opens a dialog for creating a MsgBox.
By default ( enters ), { enters }, < enters >, ' enters ', " enters ", and enters . This dialog will allow you to edit that functionality
Adds a margin to the left of the text
AHK Studio keeps track of the cursor position for all of your files. As you delete or change the names of your projects this position data becomes obsolete. This option gets rid of it
Compiles your script using Unicode 32. Same as Compile if you use the 32 bit install of AutoHotkey
Plugin: Allows you to create and maintain a Github Repository
Enables word wrap.
Hides the Word Wrap Indicators
Without this option the Scratch Pad creates a local file on your HDD
Allows you to edit past the end of a line ==Word Wrap Removes the horizontal scroll bar and wraps the lines of text
When entering a , it will automatically add a space after it
When enabled and you press enter rather than tab to auto complete an item it will add a newline
When creating comments this option will build another ; on top of any that are already there
When scrolling down a large document the caret will stay centered vertically
Hides the Indentation Guides (Look like vertical line of dots to show indentation)
Can be buggy! Highlights the current indentation
Option: When you create an include using Create Segment From Selection this will add the #Include line where the text was rather than in the main Project file
Allows you to indent lines that start with . , and or however you like
In the Project Explorer if you do not have the \ before the directory it will not sort properly. This removes that \
Requires you to hold Shift when creating a Breakpoint
Highlights the current row your caret is in
Shows EOL characters
Shows the whitespace characters
Stops AHK Studio from Auto Saving files on exit
Auto Complete will not show while editing text inside of ""
If there is a tooltip being displayed it will not allow the Auto Complete box to display
This will attempt to automatically delete matching ( ) { } [ ] etc but holding backspace to delete quickly will cause issues
If you are editing a non-ahk file it will not adjust the indents
When you have ( ) { } etc set to auto insert it will not do the Auto Complete
Runs scripts as admin (will cause a popup if you do not edit your UAC)
Asks if you are sure you want to overwrite the file.
Dialog to change the syntax of the ;auto_version
Resets the zoom to 0
Forces UTF-8 Encoding for all files
Reduces the size of the icons in the toolbars.
Moves the Quick Find above the Scintilla edit window
Disables the auto save feature of AHK Studio on exit
Stops AHK Studio from creating backups of your changed files
When entering #Include and selecting the auto complete in the dropdown it will not pop up and ask for a file
The, by default, red and green rectangles next to the line to show what has been edited will not be visible
Stops AHK Studio from adding variables created with := to your popup list
When you save a program and it is still running it will kill the process.
This will backup all of the files in your project rather than just the include files that Full Backup will do
If a file is edited while you are away from AHK Studio and focus is set back to it, it will popup with a dialog asking if you want to update your code to the new contents.
Will check for program updates when you run AHK Studio (Will only do this if you have not checked for an update withing the last hour)
Dialog windows by default do not have margins. This will add them

If your caret is to the left of a quotation mark "|" it will advance it to the end. This also works with {} () <> [] by default. Whatever is in the Auto Add dialog will work. so pressing {} will put your cursor {}| <---Here rather than putting an extra {}} at the end
When using the Find window this option will close the Find window automatically
When using the Quick Find hotkey or Edit/Quick Find it will automatically set the selection to search in if you have text selected
Displays the full tree in the Project Explorer for includes that are not in the main Projects directory
Hides the Code Explorer (Right side window)
Hides the file extensions in the Project Explorer
Will not create the folder structure in the Project Explorer
Hides the Project Explorer (Left side window)
Adds spaces after commas in selected text
Adds spaces before and after commas in selected text
Adds spaces before commas in selected text
Removes lines that are blank (`n`n)
Removes all text between /* */ and all ; comments
Prevents the edit window from scrolling past the end of the document
Plugin: Will split a line (or at least attempt to) by significant ,'s
Combines all selected lines with a , between them
If you have multiple selections of Value1 it will increment all following selections to Value2, Value3 and so on
Camel Cases Selected Text
Removes spaces from around the commas in the selected text
Plugin: Aligns selected text by a delimiter
Removes the colored statuses from the margin
When you have multiple selections it will remove the current one
Moves all selected lines Down one line
Moves all selected lines Up one line
Moves a selected word to the right
Moves a selected word to the left
Sorts all selected text by a delimiter
Dialog that will do its best to split your current document into functions and classes (not perfect)
When your caret is near a brace that has a match it will be highlighted. Using this item will remove both of them
Creates/Removes a multiple line comment surrounding the selected text in /* and */
Selects the word that your caret is in
Displays Scintilla codes for you to select. If you have entered some text it will search for codes with that text in them
Dialog to search for Scintilla codes
Shows an Auto-Complete list with all of your code vault entries
Refreshes the information for Omni-Search for the current file
Creates a new caret in the line directly above the current caret
Creates a caret in the line directly below the current caret
Displays the next file in your Project Explorer
Jumps to the previous file in your Code Explorer
Jumps to the previous Segment that you were editing
Jumps to the next Segment that was saved from the Back command
When next to a brace it will highlight all text up until the matching brace
Dialog to resize the Project Explorer and Code Explorer
Plugin: Gets rid of the window caption
Shows an Auto-Complete list of all of your Classes in the current project
Displays an Auto-Complete list of Functions in the current Project
This will show all Scintilla codes that are in the current line
This Dialog
Checks to see if there is an update for AHK Studio
Basic information about AHK Studio
Opens the help file to the command that your cursor is in
Help me out with a little donation
Opens your default web browser to the AHK Studio Wiki
Changes
